title: Beau Ryan accidentally lets slip when the new season of The Amazing Race Australia will go to air
text:
While no official air date has been announced for The Amazing Race just yet, Beau Ryan may have just given it away.

The 34-year-old former rugby league footballer is set to host the upcoming season, and during an appearance on KIIS FM's Kyle & Jackie O Show on Friday, he hinted it would be starting soon.

Discussing the upcoming season of the hit Network 10 reality show, Beau said the powers that be were hoping to capitalise on the success of The Masked Singer.

Scroll down for video

Slip of the tongue: While no official air date has been announced for The Amazing Race just yet, Beau Ryan may have just given it away

'We're trying to get it [the show] ready for the end of the month because we're trying to run off the 1.9 million Masked Singer are doing,' he said.

When host Jackie 'O' Henderson - who appears on The Masked Singer as a guessing panelist - asked if that meant The Amazing Race would start after The Masked Singer had wrapped, Beau confirmed it did.

'Yeah, yeah that's what we're trying to do,' he added.

Around the world: During an appearance on KIIS FM's Kyle & Jackie O Show on Friday, Beau hinted the show would be starting soon

According to a report by TV Blackbox on Friday, The Masked Singer will finish up on October 21, meaning it's likely The Amazing Race will begin on October 22.

TV Blackbox contacted 10 for confirmation, with the network telling the site an air date 'will be announced very soon'.

A trailer for the upcoming season of The Amazing Race was released on Wednesday, with no release date given for the show's premiere.

'This is no vacation. This is The Amazing Race, and anything can happen,' Beau says in a trailer for The Amazing Race

Following on: Discussing the upcoming season of the hit Network 10 reality show, Beau said the powers that be were hoping to capitalise on the success of The Masked Singer

'This is no vacation. This is The Amazing Race, and anything can happen,' Beau says in the trailer.

The shows features 11 teams, all racing across three continents in a bid to win the $250,000 prize money.

And this year's season will feature a pair of nuns, who believe they're in with a good chance given that they have 'the big fella on our side'.
description: While no official air date has been announced for The Amazing Race yet, Beau Ryan may have just given it away. During an appearance on the Kyle & Jackie O Show, he hinted it would be starting soon.
authors: Demeter Stamell For Daily Mail Australia
